isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 1000 MODELS From 01/01/1998 to 02/07/2004 - LIGHT SYSTEMS - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the on position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

entry.para: Check cowl fuse F33 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace breaker.
Disconnect cab feed connector (14) and measure voltage from circuit 14F to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14F, then repair.
Reconnect (14). At cab fuse holder (1A) and fuse F4, measure voltage from circuit 14A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14F/14A, then repair.
OEM exterior light system feed circuits check good.
Check breaker F15 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace breaker.
Disconnect back-up light switch connector (317) and turn key on. Measure voltage from circuit 71 (black wire with 1652) to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 71 [black wire, connector (304) or circuit 71 with 1652], dash conn. (2) or circuit 71, then repair.
Test back-up light switch (317) by placing transmission in reverse, and measuring resistance across terminals.
Reconnect (317) and disconnect dash connector (2). With transmission in reverse and at (2), measure resistance from circuit 71 to 71A.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 71A [71A, conn. (304) or white wire with 1652], then repair.
Reconnect (2) and disconnect body builder connector (194). Turn key on and with transmission in reverse, measure voltage at (194) from circuit 71A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 71A, then repair.
OEM back-up light circuits check good. If condition persists, troubleshoot body builder installed circuits.

svcsubproc.title: Headlight System - Headlight Circuits Without Daytime Running Lights

table.title: Headlight System - Headlight Circuits Without Daytime Running Lights

entry.para: Disconnect headlight switch connector (60) and at circuit 50, measure voltage to ground.
Check for open circuit breaker F1. If OK, locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 50, then repair.
At (60), measure voltage from circuit 58 to ground.
Check for open circuit breaker F2. If OK, locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58, then repair.
With headlight switch (60) in the on position, measure resistance across terminals 5 and 6 that were connected to circuits 50 and 51.
With headlight switch (60) still on, measure resistance across terminals 2 and 3 that were connected to circuits 58 and 58A.
At (60), measure resistance across terminals 1 and 2 that were connected to circuits 58B and 58A.
Remove dimmer relay (4J) and reconnect headlight switch (60). Move headlight switch to on position, and at relay socket, measure voltage from circuit 51 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 51, then repair.
With headlight switch still on, at relay socket (4J), measure voltage from circuit 51C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 51C/58B, then repair.
Disconnect dimmer switch connector (192). At platform harness circuit 51-G, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51-G/ 11-GA, then repair.
At (192), measure resistance of dimmer switch from cavity B to cavity A, with the switch in the low beam position and then in the high beam position.
< 1 ohm in low beam, > 100K ohms in high beam.
Reconnect connector (192), place dimmer switch in low beam position, and at relay socket (4J) circuit 51D, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51D, then repair.
Bench test dimmer relay (4J) by measuring resistance from terminal 3 to 4.
Bench test relay (4J) by applying +12V to pin 1, ground to pin 2, and measuring resistance from pin 3 to 5.
Re-install relay (4J), disconnect front end body builder connector (13). With dimmer switch at low beam, measure voltage at circuit 53 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53/53A, then repair.
Move dimmer switch to high beam position, and at (13), measure voltage from circuit 52 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52/52C, then repair.
With headlight switch on and dimmer switch in high beam position, does high beam indicator illuminate?
Disconnect cluster connector (27) and with switches still set, measure voltage at cavity 4 circuit 52A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52A/52C, then repair.
Replace high beam indicator bulb with known good bulb and reconnect (27). Does light illuminate?
Circuits to high beam indicator and headlight system OEM front end connector check good. If condition persists, troubleshoot body builder installed circuits.

svcsubproc.title: Headlight System - Headlight Circuits With Daytime Running Lights

table.title: Headlight System - Headlight Circuits With Daytime Running Lights

entry.para: Disconnect headlight switch connector (60) and at circuit 50, measure voltage to ground.
Check for open circuit breaker F1. If OK, locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 50, then repair.
At (60), measure voltage from circuit 58 to ground.
Check for open circuit breaker F2. If OK, locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58, then repair.
With headlight switch (60) in the on position, measure resistance across terminals 5 and 6 that were connected to circuits 50 and 51.
With headlight switch (60) still on, measure resistance across terminals 2 and 3 that were connected to circuits 58 and 58A.
At (60), measure resistance across terminals 1 and 2 that were connected to circuits 58B and 58A.
Remove dimmer relay (4J) and reconnect headlight switch (60). Move headlight switch to on position, and at relay socket, measure voltage from circuit 51 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 51, then repair.
With headlight switch still on, at relay socket (4J), measure voltage from circuit 51C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 51C/58B, then repair.
Disconnect dimmer switch connector (192). At platform harness circuit 51-G, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51-G/ 11-GA, then repair.
At (192), measure resistance of dimmer switch from cavity B to cavity A, with the switch in the low beam position and then in the high beam position.
< 1 ohm in low beam, > 100K ohms in high beam.
Reconnect connector (192), place dimmer switch in low beam position, and at relay socket (4J) circuit 51D, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51D, then repair.
Bench test dimmer relay (4J) by measuring resistance from terminal 3 to 4.
Bench test relay (4J) by applying +12V to pin 1, ground to pin 2, and measuring resistance from pin 3 to 5.
Re-install relay (4J), disconnect front end body builder connector (13). With dimmer switch at low beam, measure voltage at circuit 53 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53/53A, then repair.
Move dimmer switch to high beam position, and at (13), measure voltage from circuit 52 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52/52C, then repair.
With headlight switch on and dimmer switch in high beam position, does high beam indicator illuminate?
Disconnect cluster connector (27) and with switches still set, measure voltage at cavity 4 circuit 52A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52A/52C, then repair.
Replace high beam indicator bulb with known good bulb and reconnect (27). Does light illuminate?
Circuits to high beam indicator and headlight system OEM front end connector check good. If condition persists, troubleshoot body builder installed circuits.
Check fuse F7 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Check circuit breaker F17 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace circuit breaker.
Disconnect DRL module connector (15) and measure voltage from circuit 66A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66A, then repair.
At (15) measure voltage from circuit 66A to 66-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 66-G/ 11-GB, then repair.
At (15) measure voltage from circuit 66 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66, then repair.
With headlight switch on, dimmer switch in low beam position and at (15), measure voltage from circuit 66C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66C/53A, then repair.
With headlight switch on, dimmer switch in high beam and at (15), measure voltage from circuit 66E to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 66AE/52C, then repair.
Reconnect DRL connector (15). With headlight switch off and parking brake disengaged, turn key switch on. Do headlights illuminate at approx. 60% brightness?
DRL module and OEM head- light circuits check good.
With the headlight switch on, does the instrument cluster back lighting illuminate?
Disconnect cluster connector (28). With headlight switch in park or on position, measure voltage from cavity 2 circuit 62 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62/58B, then repair.
Turn headlight switch off. Reconnect (28) and disconnect cluster connector (27). Install jumper wire from cluster terminal 2 to ground. Go to next step.
Turn headlight switch on and with panel dimmer in full bright position, measure voltage from cluster (27) terminal 1 to ground.
Panel back lighting and circuits check good. Reconnect connectors.
With headlight switch on, does the headlight switch illuminate?
Disconnect headlight switch connector (60). Install jumper wire from cavity 2 circuit 58 to cavity 1 circuit 58B. Measure voltage from cavity 7 circuit 62C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62C/62A, then repair.
Remove jumper and at (60), measure resistance from cavity 8 circuit 62-GD to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit in circuit 62-GD/ 11-GB, then repair.
With headlight switch on, does the cruise on/off switch illuminate?
Disconnect cruise on/off switch (391). With headlight switch on, measure voltage from circuit 62E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62E, then repair.
At (391) measure resistance from circuit 62-GA to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62-GA/ 11-GA, then repair.
With headlight switch on, does the cruise set/resume switch illuminate?
Disconnect cruise set/resume switch (392). With headlight switch on, measure voltage from circuit 62F to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62F, then repair.
At (392) measure resistance from circuit 62-GB to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62-GB/ 11-GA, then repair.
With headlight switch on, does the transmission shifter back lighting illuminate?
Disconnect shifter back lighting connector. With headlight switch on, measure voltage from circuit 62H to ground.
Replace shifter back light or assembly.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62H, then repair.
With headlight switch on, does the transmission oil temperature gauge illuminate?
At gauge light feed terminal and with headlight switch on, measure voltage from circuit 62J to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62J, gauge conn. (476), or circuit 62J, then repair.
With headlight switch off and at gauge light ground terminal, measure resistance of circuit 11-GC to ground.
Replace light or gauge. Go to next step.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GC, then repair.
Panel lights and switch illumination circuits check good.

svcsubproc.title: Parking Light and Tail Light Feed Circuits

table.title: Parking Light and Tail Light Feed Circuits

entry.para: With headlight switch in park position, do the tail lights work?
Disconnect rear end body builder connector (194). With light switch in park position, measure voltage from circuit 58D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58D/58B, then repair.
With headlight switch in park position, do the parking lights work?
Disconnect headlight switch connector (60). At switch, measure resistance across terminals 1 and 3.
Reconnect (60) and disconnect front end body builder conn. (13). Measure voltage from circuit 58A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58A, then repair.
OEM parking light and tail light circuits check good. If condition persists, troubleshoot body builder installed circuits.
Check circuit breaker F4 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Disconnect stoplight switch connector (51), and measure voltage from circuit 70 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage circuit 70, then repair.
At switch (51), measure resistance across switch terminals with brakes applied.
Disconnect brake monitor module connector (49). Measure resistance between connector (49) cavity H circuit 90R and connector (51) circuit 70B.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 70B/90R, then repair.
Disconnect body builder connector (194). Measure resistance of circuit 70A between connector (194) cavity A and connector (51).
Locate open in circuit 70A, then repair.
Reconnect (49), (51) and (194) and disconnect ECM connector (379). Measure voltage from circuit 97N, cavity 43 to ground with brakes applied.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97N, dash conn. (3), or circuit 97N/70B, then repair.
Reconnect (379). OEM stoplight switch circuitry checks good. If condition persists, troubleshoot body builder installed circuits.
